column5: Been a couple busy days, the steelheading around here is just starting to blow up and it is hot. Every drift u have a fish on double headers triple headers just crazy in one day 3 guys boated over 50 fish. the weather has cooperated for us and so has the mighty Niagara. Every thing seems to work right now roe, streamers, minnows, gulp minnows, single egg imitation. Cant complain, just thought i would share some porn with yas. This isnt even nearly a quarter of the fish i got just these are the better quality pics.  Just click the picture.
Sounds like some great action... and here everyone wasn't bothering because it was all muddy ! lol
sounds like a great time,congrats on some nice fish

let them think that irishfield, keeps the bugs away. The thing is the fish are always there no matter how muddy it is, ppl think u wont catch fish and u may not but you will never know if you dont try!
Nice fish porn !!!! looks like you have been very busy.....cheers
Great report Hellfish.  I love the Niagara, any time of year.  Yep, just because they can't see, doesn't mean they can't smell  Joey

thnx for the comments. Joey your right to a extent im sure they do smell it in the mud no doubt about that but usually it is a reaction bite. Weve been out in 3-6 inch vis and landed 20 fish in the boat. Right now they are laying some traps with lakers in them leaving them for 21 days and going to test the lakers to see the level of contaniments.

i think you just made my week! lol my charter with Fishmaster was postponed last week because of all the rain, and then this week wasnt looking that much better so I was starting to fear we wouldn't be able to go this week either. did you fish the Lower river?? If you go back this week please keep us posted on the fishing conditions
ahhh, to be in a boat on the river and away from the crowd at queenston... only time i ever managed to catch a bow in the niagara was from a boat, 2yrs ago next january lol
